posts.name: Belle Isle Seafood
posts.note: Belle Isle Seafood is a local seafood, including chowder and lobster rolls, in a spare, industrial space with inlet views. I ordered their fried Seafood Combo which had fried fish, shrimp, scallops, and I think clams along with French fries and cole slaw. No one can eat all the food you get by themselves. I'm glad I had help finishing it off.

posts.name: Blunch
posts.note: The Blunch breakfast and lunch counter is turning out hearty pressed sandwiches and chocolate chip cookies until late.

posts.name: Bob’s Lobster
posts.note: Bob’s Lobster is a rough-and-ready fish market and seafood shack with river views along with a cozy, laid-back vibe.

posts.name: Brody's Diner
posts.note: Brody's Diner is an all-day breakfast, burgers, and sandwiches served in a simple restaurant with truck parking.

posts.name: Cabot’s Ice Cream
posts.note: Cabot’s Ice Cream is a family-friendly diner with dozens of ice cream flavors and three square meals in a nostalgic setting. Order the peanut butter fluff boat.

posts.name: Casa Razdora
posts.note: Casa Razdora serves housemade pasta, pizza, sandwiches, and Italian eats in a cozy, bustling setting and is only open weekdays.

posts.name: Craigie On Main
posts.note: Craigie On Main is a high-end restaurant with innovative, French-inspired locavore fare, and seasonal tasting menus. Chef Tony combines his trademark French-inspired 'refined rusticity' with an unyielding passion for the best local, seasonal, and organic ingredients. Their menu changes daily so you can be sure their ingredients are the very best of the best that day. From photos, I have seen if you have a group of people you should order the half a pig's face/head.

posts.name: Cutty’s
posts.note: Cutty’s uses locally sourced, and made-in-house ingredients define this busy breakfast-lunch soup and sandwich joint. You need to get one of the pork sandwiches. Cutty's makes home-made pickled fennel for the pork fennel sandwich.

posts.name: Deep Ellum
posts.note: Deep Ellum is a small, convivial gastropub with an eclectic fare, along with a craft beer list, classic cocktails, and a patio. You should order the house-cured salmon sandwich on a bagel, or the Chicken 2 Ways features smoked andouille-style sausage, confit thigh, cheese grits, braised collard greens, and peach relish.

posts.name: Little Donkey
posts.note: Little Donkey is a chef-driven spot with cool vibe serving international small plates, along with craft beers and cocktails.

posts.name: Lone Star Taco Bar
posts.note: Lone Star Taco Bar is a hip, wood-paneled cantina serving modern Mexican street food plus mezcals, and many tequilas. You should order the Chicken Ranchero Tostada, with house beans, ranchero braised chicken, napa cabbage and crema placed on a crispy tortilla or the beef barbacoa tacos.

posts.name: Maria's Pastry Shop
posts.note: Maria's Pastry Shop is an unassuming Italian baker is offering acclaimed sweets such as cannoli, torrone, and marzipan.

posts.name: Mary Chung
posts.note: Mary Chung is a humble, old-school cash-only Chinese mainstay specializing in spicy Sichuan plates. They serve a Chinese (Mandarin and Szechuan) Brunch on Saturday and Sunday from 11:30 AM - 3:30 PM. I'm looking forward to eating their dim sum brunch next time I'm in Boston/Cambridge.

posts.name: Mike's Pastry
posts.note: Mike's Pastry is a renowned Italian bake shop is providing cannoli in multiple flavors, gelati, and biscotti since 1946. Mike's has some of the best cannoli I have ever had. On top of that, they are huge. NOTE: They have multiple locations.
posts.cptn: Chocolate mouse with chocolate chip covered cannoli shell and a ricotta-filled cannoli from Mike’s Pastry in Boston’s North End.

posts.name: Mr. Bartley's Burger Cottage
posts.note: Mr. Bartley's Burger Cottage is a Harvard Square institution and student favorite for burgers, fries, frappes, and kitschy decor. I have read customers line up down the block each day at lunch for a coveted seat, devouring their homemade burgers, onion rings, sweet potato fries, frappes, and lime rickeys. From their website, 'Bartley's has a fast-paced, wacky atmosphere. Our dining room looks like a dorm room filled with posters, bumper stickers, and funny signs. In the summer months, a small outdoor café gives diners the chance to people-watch in the sun. Future husbands and wives have met across our signature central table for single diners.'

posts.name: Polcari’s Coffee
posts.note: Polcari’s Coffee is a circa-1932 storied shop purveying dozens of varieties of coffee beans, nuts, and Italian delicacies.

posts.name: Salumeria Italiana
posts.note: Salumeria Italiana is a quaint fixture selling a range of Italian groceries, including meats, cheeses, pasta, and sauces. They supposedly have the best head cheese/Coppa di Testa in the country.

posts.name: Red Lentil Vegetarian and Vegan Restaurant
posts.note: Red Lentil Vegetarian and Vegan Restaurant is a destination that serves vegetarian and vegan Indian food with seasonal ingredients with gluten-free options, along with wine, and beer.

posts.name: Roxy's Grilled Cheese
posts.note: Roxy's Grilled Cheese is a cheery spin-off of a popular food truck with inventive grilled cheese sandwiches, poutine, and burgers. Don't forget to go through walk-in cooler door to the old school pinball arcade. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Sarma Restaurant
posts.note: Sarma Restaurant is a modern Mediterranean menu, featuring meze, and Middle Eastern favorites offered in colorful digs. From their website, 'Sarma is a restaurant and bar where food, drink, and music come together in a vibrant celebration of the good things in life. Modeled after the traditional meyhanes of Turkey, the menu is a large selection of small plates ( meze ) that are designed to be shared alongside food-friendly cocktails, craft beers, or a glass of wine from a small but carefully selected list. Chef Cassie mostly stays true to Mediterranean flavors, but she draws inspiration from places she visits and people she meets and then blends her experiences into a style of cooking that is uniquely her own. Her goal is to strike a balance between the familiar and the unknown. Either way, she respects the fundamental flavor profiles that got her attention in the first place, so the food tastes exciting and modern, but authentic.

posts.name: Saus Boston
posts.note: Saus Boston is a local eatery featuring fries and beer, along with 15 sauces, which is particularly popular late-night. From their website, 'Saus was started by three local university grads who were ousted from their company due to the 2008 recession. With the help of their friends and family, we were able to fulfill a common dream of opening up a restaurant.'

posts.name: Ugly Mug Diner
posts.note: Ugly Mug Diner is a hopping daytime cafe dispensing inventive American diner fare and specialty drinks in their energetic surrounds. From their website, 'Located in the heart of historic Salem Massachusetts, The Ugly Mug Diner is the perfect spot when you’re looking for fresh, hot, breakfast or brunch served up with love. Saddle up to one of our stools, sip a handcrafted latte, and chow down on one of our signature menu items such as Chipotle Brisket Hash, Duck Confit and waffle, or any one of our amazing Benedicts.'

posts.name: Veggie Galaxy
posts.note: Veggie Galaxy is an imaginative twist on an old-school diner specializing in from-scratch vegan and vegetarian options. I ordered the Pearl Street Redhead Omelette (Portobellos, Caramelized Onion, Feta, Roasted Red Pepper Sauce) and don't forget to ask for their home-made hot sauce it's got the perfect amount of heat and spice for flavor.
